intro: Cyperus unioloides f. insularis, commonly known as the Island flatsedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its three-ranked leaves and spikelet-based inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-poor soils. Its foliage is slender and grass-like, with a distinctive silver-gray sheen on the underside of the leaves. The inflorescence consists of dense clusters of small, three-ranked spikelets, which are often subtended by bracts.
